snippet: The government said there was still not enough evidence to recommend routine removal, but allowed free replacement for some women who received the implants under the National Health Service.
abstract: British government says that there is still not enough evidence to recommend routine removal of breast implants made with low-grade silicone but it also says it will allow about 3,000 women who received the implants under the National Health Service to have them taken out and replaced free of charge; many women say the remarks have left them more confused and frightened than ever.
lead_paragraph: The government said there was still not enough evidence to recommend routine removal, but allowed free replacement for some women who received the implants under the National Health Service.

headline.seo: British Statement on Defective Implants Offers Limited Help
headline.main: British Clarification on Implant Scandal Leaves Women Only More Confused
headline.print_headline: British Clarification on Implant Scandal Leaves Women Only More Confused
